sentences.en: Containment of highly lethal Ehola virus a serious public health challenge.
sentences.cn: 对高致死埃博拉病毒的控制一直是公共健康关注的热点.

sentences.en: Fire crews are hoping they can achieve full containment of the fire before the winds pick up.
sentences.cn: 消防队员们希望他们能够在起风前对大火做到完全控制。

sentences.en: He gave an only sense says containment alonge is not enough.
sentences.cn: 他说所以可能的措施都要用上.

sentences.en: In general, the stricter the physical containment, the less strict is the biological containment.
sentences.cn: 总之物理防护措施越严,生物防护措施则可稍松.

sentences.en: Insularity and self - containment, it is argued, go hand in hand.
sentences.cn: 他们争论说, 心胸狭窄和 自我 封闭是并存的.

sentences.en: Isolation and containment are other more passive variants on this option.
sentences.cn: 孤立和遏止是这个选择的其他更消极的变种.

sentences.en: NOTE: Containment via closed system is considered a separate facility.
sentences.cn: 备注: 经过密闭系统的污染被视为是单独的设施.

sentences.en: Officials say the fire is about 40 percent containment.
sentences.cn: 官员表示大概控制了大火的40%.

sentences.en: Physical containment is self - explanatory and encompasses several aspects of laboratory areas.
sentences.cn: 物理遏制是毋须解释的,它包括实验领域的许多方面.

sentences.en: Ring containment is a proven method of halting a smallpox epidemic.
sentences.cn: 在阻止天花传染方面,圆形地区隔离是一种得到验证的有效方法.

sentences.en: Such laboratories are designed and equipped for physical containment and are posted with biohazard warning symbols.
sentences.cn: 这样的实验室是为了物理防护措施而设计与装备的,而且贴出生物危险警告标志.

sentences.en: These systems are ideal for secondary containment applications inside or outside.
sentences.cn: 这些系统是理想的适用室内和室外的中级系统.

sentences.en: We'll fly outside it here, just to see this sort of containment.
sentences.cn: 我们飞离这里, 也只看到这个天穹.

sentences.en: We're still very much in the containment phase of this infection.
sentences.cn: 我们仍然在控制猪流感的阶段.

sentences.en: Your list might include such things as cost containment, quality, or customer satisfaction.
sentences.cn: 你的清单上应列有诸如成本控制 、 产品质量 、 客户满意程度等内容.

words.tran_cn: 泰然自若的，从容的；被控制的
包含；遏制（contain的过去分词）；容纳
包含；控制；容纳；牵制（敌军）

trans.tran_cn: 控制， （对他国力量的）遏制
trans.tran_en: Containment is the action or policy of keeping another country's power or area of control within acceptable limits or boundaries
